p: The objective of this study was to identify plant species traditionally used in the treatment of dental disorders with growth inhibitory activity and good selectivity against Porphyromonas gingivalis. This approach was based on the rationale that P. gingivalis is linked to dental diseases (especially periodontitis) and ethnobotanical data on the long-standing use of plants for oral hygiene and in the treatment of dental disorders could serve as a guide to identifying natural products with activity against this pathogen.
